document_data.name: Throne Archon
document_data.subtype3e: [[Celestial archon|Archon]], [[:Category:Creatures with the good subtype|good]], [[:Category:Creatures with the lawful subtype|lawful]]
document_data.mainbody: '''Throne archons''' were the rulers of the cities of [[Mount Celestia]] and judges of the [[Celestial archon|archons]]. As far as the day-to-day matters of Celestia, they were the true rulers of the archons.
document_data.Description:
Thrones were the tallest of the archons, towering between ten and twelve feet (three and three and a half meters) tall and often weighing 700 pounds (320 kilograms). They were flawless in appearance and had gold-colored skin, fair hair, and radiant blue eyes. Looking into a throne archon's eyes, one felt warmth and love, yet at the same time, their faces were stoic, full of ageless wisdom.

Throne archons were always garbed in a magical, golden suit of [[plate mail]], usually with helmets. Their breastplates radiated light. They carried enormous, rune-covered [[greatsword]]s, for which they were famous in the [[Outer Planes]]. These ''[[vorpal]]'' weapons were considered almost a part of throne archon itself.
document_data.Personality:
Throne archons were full of wisdom and strong convictions. They were patient, attentive, and benevolent creatures, dedicated to judging rightly in all matters.

Most throne archons hated being called to the [[Material Plane]] by magic, as it prevented them from fulfilling their important duties. In this sense, they were not considered adventurous; they rarely left their assigned realms. They also despised combat, perhaps more than even other archons, and preferred to allow their [[sword archon]]s to fight for them.
document_data.Abilities:
Like all archons, thrones could speak and understand all spoken languages and could telepathically communicate with any being. They could [[Teleport without error|teleport]] anywhere that they wanted without a chance of failure. They could also create a source of [[continual flame]] whenever they desired. Throne archons and anyone close to them were [[Magic circle against evil|magically protected from evil]] at all times. Beyond this, they had a vast array of other powerful inherent magical abilities—mimicking spells cast by both [[wizard]]s and [[cleric]]s—including the power to [[Resurrection (spell)|resurrect the dead]].

Even though they did not have wings, throne archons could soar through the air effortlessly.

Thrones were resistant to all but the most powerful magical spells, immune to petrification and electricity, resistant to poison, and could not be affected by mundane weapons or even low-powered magical ones. They could also [[darkvision|see in darkness]]. and in dim light. Throne archons were even more intelligent than [[trumpet archon]]s.

A power unique to throne archons was their so-called "penitentiary gaze". Any non-[[lawful good]] creature gazed upon by a throne was powerfully effected by the sight of the archon's blue eyes. Such a creature was overwhelmed with a sense of remorse for her or his sins, whatever had moved her or him further from the ideals of goodness and order. The effects of such remorse varied, depending on the outlook of the one so affected. The guilt of evil creatures physically manifested as painful boils; even creatures neither prone to evil or good received such skin ailments, though not as severely. More chaotic creatures would see visions revealing the deviation from the path of law. Such visions were so realistic, that it physically tired the observer, resulting in total exhaustion to the most chaotic persons.

Throne archons could also channel their power into mortal servants,
document_data.Combat: If forced to fight, throne archons would gaze upon their victims to fill them with exhaustion and painful boils before decapitating them with their massive greatswords. When engaged in battle, they also produced a menacing aura of righteousness that negatively affected their foes' ability to fight back, even if the victim did not catch the gaze of the throne archon.

Society.Promotion:
Throne archons were created by the promotion of willing [[trumpet archon]]s who had obtained platinum accoutrements.

Throne archons were promoted to tome archons,

document_data.Ecology: The only thing consumed by throne archons was a nectar made from the fruits growing in the Seven Heavens mystically combined with literal praises from the lower archons.
